original: Forselius, Carl Olof, med. lic., pro-sektor, Göteborg, f. 28/11/80 i Vreta-kloster, östergötl. 1., av kapt. Adolf Henrik F. o. Ulla Gyllencreutz. G. 14 m. Margareta Cavetz. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 98, med. kand. 03, med. lic. 08. Aman. v. ögonavd. å Akad. sjukh. i Upps. 08-09, patol. anatom v. Sahlgr. sjukh. i Gbg 10-23, prosektor där sed. 24. Led. av stadsfullm. 19-41, förste v. ordf. där 34-41, led. av div. komm. ndr o. styr., led. av styr. f. Gbgs hög-sk., led. av direkt, f. S :t Jörgens sjukh., v. ordf. i styr. f. Gbgs lyriska teater, huviman i Gustaf V ju’b:fond. KV02kl, RNO.
translated: Forselius, Carl Olof, MD, PhD, prosector, Gothenburg, born November 28th, 1880 in Vreta-Kloster, Östergötland, Sweden. Son of Captain Adolf Henrik F. and Ulla Gyllencreutz. Married to Margareta Cavetz in 1914. He completed his secondary education in Linköping in 1898, received his medical degree in 1903, and his PhD in 1908. He was an assistant in the ophthalmology department at Uppsala University Hospital from 1908 to 1909, and worked as a patho-anatomist at Sahlgren's Hospital in Gothenburg from 1910 to 1923, later becoming a prosector there until 1924. From 1919 to 1941, he was a member of the Gothenburg city council, serving as its first deputy chairman from 1934 to 1941. He was a member of various committees and boards, including the board of Gothenburg University, the board of St. George's Hospital, and deputy chairman of the board of the Gothenburg Lyrical Theater. He also served as the chairman of the Gustaf V Jubilee Fund. He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star in 1942.

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star
